name: loubia
ingredients: 2 large tomatoes (peeled and chopped into small pieces)
1 tablespoon of chopped parsley and coriander
Spices: 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp cumin, a pinch of pepper, salt
steps: Soak the white beans overnight. Drain them.
In a pressure cooker or a pot, drizzle some olive oil. Add the tomatoes, grated garlic, chopped parsley/coriander, salt, pepper, turmeric, and cumin. Mix well.
Add the tomato paste and mix.
Then add the drained white beans and the 2 large glasses of water. Mix again.

Close the pressure cooker (if using). Bring to a boil, then lower to medium heat and cook for 25 minutes (in a pressure cooker) or until the beans are tender (in a pot, about 1.5 hours, adding water if necessary).
